trans-unit.source: Represents a control with a single piece of content of any type.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> can contain any type of common language runtime object (such as a string or a <xref:System.DateTime> object) or a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> object (such as a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Rectangle> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel>).
This enables you to add rich content to controls such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox>.
The following illustration shows four buttons whose <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property is set to one of the following:
A string.
A <xref:System.DateTime> object.
A <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> object.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> control that contains other <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects.
![Four buttons](~/add/media/controlcontentmodelbuttons.PNG "Four buttons")
Four buttons with different types of content
A<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> has a limited default style.
If you want to enhance the appearance of the control, you can create a new <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate>.
For more information, see [Data Templating Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-templating-overview.md).
Another typical scenario is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> to show more information about an item selected in an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> control.

For more information, see [How to: Bind to a Collection and Display Information Based on Selection](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/how-to-bind-to-a-collection-and-display-information-based-on-selection.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref> class.
Adds a specified object as the child of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref>.
The object to add.
Adds a specified text string to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref>.
The string to add.
Gets or sets the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref>.

Because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property is of type <xref:System.Object>, there are no restrictions on what you can put in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> is displayed by a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter>, which is in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>.

Every <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> type in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter> in its default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>.

For more information about how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter> displays <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A>, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
Text or a single object.
An object that contains the control's content.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property if it is displayed as a string.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat%2A> can be a predefined, composite, or custom string format.
For more information about string formats, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat%2A> property is ignored.
A composite string that specifies how to format the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property if it is displayed as a string.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the data template used to display the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref>.
Set this property to a <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate> to specify the appearance of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>.
For more information on data templates, see [Data Templating Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-templating-overview.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*resourceExtension*
A markup extension that identifies how to reference the template resource, either `StaticResource` or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-resources.md).
*styleResourceKey*
The key that identifies the requested template selector.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended.
For more information, see [Inline Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/inline-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A data template.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a template selector that enables an application writer to provide custom template-selection logic.

Typically, you create a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector> when you have more than one <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate> for the same type of objects and you want to supply your own logic to choose a <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate> to apply based on the properties of each data object.
Note that if you have objects of different types you can set the <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate.DataType%2A> property on the <xref:System.Windows.DataTemplate>.
If you do that, then there is no need to create a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector>.
Furthermore, if you have objects of the same type but with different properties, you can also consider using a <xref:System.Windows.DataTrigger> or a data converter.
For more information, see [Data Templating Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-templating-overview.md).

To create a template selector, create a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector> and override the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector.SelectTemplate%2A> method.
After your class is defined, you can assign an instance of the class to the template selector property of your element.

If both the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate%2A> properties are set, then this property is ignored.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*ResourceExtension*
A markup extension that identifies how to reference the template resource, either `StaticResource` or `DynamicResource`.
See [XAML Resources](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-resources.md).
*TemplateSelectorKey*
The key that identifies the requested template selector.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A data template selector.
The default value is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref> contains content.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property is `null`, this property returns `false`.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl"></xref> has content; otherwise `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.HasContent"></xref> dependency property.
Gets an enumerator to the content control's logical child elements.
An enumerator.
The default value is `null`.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property changes.
The old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat"></xref> property changes.
The old value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat"></xref>.
The new value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentStringFormat"></xref>.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate"></xref> property changes.
The old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplate"></xref> property.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector"></xref> property changes.
The old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelector"></xref> property.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property should be persisted.
This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> property does not have a simple default value.
This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value.

You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content"></xref> property should be persisted; otherwise, `false`.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
